intro: Siumis heterophyla, commonly known as the variable sium, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many economically important crops. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and wetlands. Its leaves are alternate, simple, and often have a slightly hairy texture. Siumis heterophyla produces small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in racemes, which attract various pollinators.
